text: a healthy breakfast is the best way to
start your day but sometimes it's hard
to decide which way to go but this
recipe has everything whole-grain hearty
waffles and probiotic friendly yogurt
and antioxidant rich blueberries so to
make these waffles is so simple take one
cup and a half of whole-grain flour do
that combine 2 tablespoons of toasted
wheat germ and toasted wheat germ is a
great source of vitamin E and holic acid
we're going to sweeten it with just a
couple of tablespoons of cane sugar half
a teaspoon of coarse salt we're going to
have one and a half teaspoons baking
powder whisk the dry ingredients
together and then make your wet mixture
for this we're going to have one and a
half cups of milk you can use whole or
reduced fat 1/4 cup canola oil 1 large
egg and 1 tsp vanilla for flavor I think
this really brings out the nice nutty
notes of the whole-grain flour whisk
this until everything is nice and
combined so now add your wet mixture to
the dry mixture and this batter is so
easy to put together you could make this
on a quick weekday morning or enjoy it
for a more leisurely weekend breakfast
and then just mix until everything is
combined you don't want to overwork this
too much batter is mixed and now it's
time to get cooking so I've had my
waffle iron over here quietly preheating
and I think that's one of the main keys
to really nice crispy crunchy waffles is
an adequately heated waffle iron so
don't skip out on that just coat it
really lightly with a little nonstick
cooking spray and for these deep style
Belgian waffles I'm going to use about
half a cup of mixture but it may vary
based on your make and model just follow
the manufacturer's instructions
I'm working quickly fill all four
cavities this is a great way to get
breakfast or crowd together in one fell
swoop
last one and then use a little spatula
to just help it to the edges and the
waffle iron will do the rest so for half
a cup of mixture this is going to take
about eight minutes but really you want
to wait until they're nice and golden
and crispy it's been eight minutes and
my kitchen smells amazing check on the
waffles - oh they're gorgeous they're
crispy crunchy golden brown and I find
it's easy just to remove them using a
fork and make sure you get all of them
out because you don't want them to over
cook so you can either enjoy them all
now or you can let them cool completely
and then freeze them and then you can
reheat them really easily for quick
breakfast on the go our finishing
touches we're going to top with a dollop
of yogurt I'm using Greek here because I
like the consistency but you could also
use regular plain this adds such a nice
creamy richness in addition to all the
wonderful beneficial probiotics of our
cultured yogurt friends I'm going to add
a nice little sprinkling of blueberries
now blueberries are one of those berries
or fruits I should say that you should
try to pick organic if possible you
could also use sliced strawberries or
raspberries whatever you have on hand
and then it wouldn't be waffle breakfast
without a little maple syrup so a
healthy drizzle there this healthy
breakfast is getting me psyched to start
my day
you
